column4: toshiba satellite, amd64, 10.04 ....  external speakers and earphones WORK.... microphone does not... suggestions?
go to sound preferences, then input tab, and try changing the "microphone" setting, and ee if you can get it working

yepper, been there done that... the input level indicators do NOT change/light up....the microphone worked when the machine arrived and had windows* on it... nuked the hd and did fresh install of 10.04... slowly getting things working... sound is ok... microphone not, nor does backlit keyboard work.
what is your sound device, do you know?
hmmmm... realtek... tho i am under the impression that the radeon card also did sound
look at the "hardware" tab... and what is that set to
internal audio / 1 output 1 input Analog Stereo duplex... the other choice there is for the HDMI stereo output... internal audio is checked
what do you have ti set to now?
settings for that is analog stereo duplex
i honestly don't know, sounds like your mic is not supported yet, is this a fairly new laptop?

fairly new toshiba satellite A660D laptop, all AMD 64d,  came with windows 7 which was nuked in a format... 10.04 is the only OS... i have gotten sound to work in both the onboard speakers and earphones.... the backlite screen works... the microphone and the backlit keyboard are the only 2 issues left to fix.
i dunno.. sometimes hardware support is a little better on the 32bit end, maybe boot a 32bit live cd and see if the mic works?..

hmmm... i know the mic works... at least in windows... as did everything else... i do not have  a 32 version of 10.04 and not sure if i have enough d/l capacity left for the month on my wildblue connection... any other suggestions?
try 10.10 maybe... it's a fairly new laptop, maybe it's supported better in 10.10
that would be my next choice... as soon as my d/l numbers for the month drop... being on satellite does have drawbacks.  :)   Thank You for your help.
no prob, hope it works out
